page.title: 02Religion in Frizinghall
page.content: Religion in Frizinghall. In Frizinghall nearly half the people living there are Muslims.The children sometimes find it difficult to mix with white children because of their race and religion even though they were born in Bradford and are British Citizens.Many houses have been made in to Mosques - any adult who is well qualified and can read the Qu'ran (The Holy Book of Islam) can teach there. When the children go home from school they may eat a chappati or have tea before going to Mosque. At Mosque they remove their shoes then read the Qu'ran,the teacher,Usta Ji,puts a tick when a child has finished reading.They sit on the floor for two hours,when they leave backs and legs are aching. No-one must talk in the Mosque.
